landing.bio: I am a Computer Science student at the University of Cambridge interested in machine learning and full-stack development. I am very ambitious and curious about the world. I don't like plateau and too much routine and I enjoy solving new problems, creative thinking and learning.

experience.aboutWork:
creating web applications in JavaScript
analyzing 3D transformations and their implementations in Three.js
creating mobile applications in React Native
creating backend using Express.js and MongoDB
teaching theoretical and practical Machine Learning in Python

experience.position: Participant in a mini-internship organized by the Polish National Fund for Gifted Children
experience.organization: Nencki Institute of Experimental Biology - Laboratory of Neuroinformatics
experience.aboutWork: creating and optimazing neural networks using the Keras API
creating software in Xamarin technology for the Android platform (api 19+)

education.degree: Matex - special class for mathematically gifted students
education.gpa: 100% in Computer Science, Maths and English official graduation exams

paradigmsAndTools.name: Machine Learning and Data Processing in Python (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib, keras, tensorflow)

interests.paragraphOne: Apart from Computer Science, I love sports. I regularly play football and work out at a gym.
interests.paragraphTwo: Moreover, I like music. I have graduated from a music school and in my free time I play the guitar, the piano and sing.
interests.paragraphThree: Additionally, I am very curious about the surrounding world. I learn languages (Spanish and German at the moment) and I read about psychology, geography, economy and politics.

university.awardDetail: the Green IoT award and the MongoDB award during the 'Hack Cambridge 2020' hackathon
Best Hack for Social Good award and startmeup sponsor prize during the 'Oxford Hack 2019' Hackathon
the Winner of the trading challenge organized by the Cambridge University Algorithmic Trading Society and the IMC trading company
2nd place in the spring edition of the Wawcode 2019 Hackathon in Warsaw
People's choice award in the Cambridge-Bradfield blockchain Hackathon (CBHACK)

earlier.awardDetail: the Finalist of the 67th and the 69th editions of Polish Mathematical Olympiad
the Laureate of the 17th, the 18th and the 19th editions of the Mathematical Competition for High School Students organised by the Warsaw University of Technology
the Laureate of the Jagiellonian Mathematical Tournament 2017/2018
the Winner of the Mathematical League of the Warsaw University of Technology (2018)
the Laureate of the 11th polish edition of the International Challenge on Informatics and Computational Thinking 'Bebras'

the recipient of the Mazovian scholarship for talented students awarded for a project concerned with creating an interactive website popularizing inversion - one of the most important mathematical transformations
the Laureate of the 10th edition of the Mathematical Olympiad for Lower Secondary School Students
the scholar of the Polish National Fund for Gifted Children
2nd place in the international, team mathematical competition NABOJ 2015/2016
the Finalist of the Physics 2014/2015 and the Philosophy 2013/2014 regional competitions
